com.camerontec.util.io.socket

Class BlockingSelectableChannelReadMultiplexer<T extends SelectableChannelReference>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.io.socket.AbstractSelectableChannelReadMultiplexer<T>
      • com.camerontec.util.io.socket.BlockingSelectableChannelReadMultiplexer<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The selectable channel reference type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    SelectableChannelReadMultiplexer<T>

    public final class BlockingSelectableChannelReadMultiplexer<T extends SelectableChannelReference>
extends AbstractSelectableChannelReadMultiplexer<T>
    Channel read multiplexer implementation which uses a java.nio.channels.Selector to block the multiplexing thread when there are no readable channels.

    All channels are registered with a single selector instance and the single multiplexer thread is blocked by the selector when none of the registered channels are readable. Note that it only blocks when none of the channels are readable, not on each iteration. Nevertheless, this implementation is likely to be subject to context switch induced latency following a block.

    In order to reduce context switch latency somewhat - at the cost of some extra CPU cycles - it is possible to configure this instance to block only after a first trying to busy/wait (i.e. spin) and/or yielding the multiplexer thread using the BlockingSelectableChannelReadMultiplexer(String, NamedTaskExecutorService, long, long, TimeUnit) constructor variant. When this variant is used, prior to blocking, we first spin for a while then yield for a while before finally blocking only if there are still no readable channels.

      • BlockingSelectableChannelReadMultiplexer

        public BlockingSelectableChannelReadMultiplexer(String taskName,
                                                NamedTaskExecutorService executor)
                                         throws IOException
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        taskName - The name of this multiplexer task. Must not be null or empty.
        executor - The task executor. Must not be null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the thread name is null or empty or the CPU lock is null.
        IOException - On error opening the selector.

      • BlockingSelectableChannelReadMultiplexer

        public BlockingSelectableChannelReadMultiplexer(String taskName,
                                                NamedTaskExecutorService executor,
                                                long spinTimeout,
                                                long yieldTimeout,
                                                TimeUnit timeUnit)
                                         throws IOException
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        taskName - The name of this multiplexer task. Must not be null or empty.
        executor - The task executor. Must not be null.
        spinTimeout - If > 0 specifies the time to spin awaiting a readable channel.
        yieldTimeout - If > 0 specifies the time to yield awaiting a readable channel. This time is always in addition to the spinTimeout.
        timeUnit - The time unit.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the thread name is null or empty or the executor is null.
        IOException - On error opening the selector.

      • readableChannels

        protected boolean readableChannels()
        Description copied from class: AbstractSelectableChannelReadMultiplexer
        Return whether there are currently any readable channels.

        The concrete implementation may block the caller if necessary, however, it should attempt not to do so unless no channels are currently readable.

        Specified by:
        readableChannels in class AbstractSelectableChannelReadMultiplexer<T extends SelectableChannelReference>
        Returns:
        True if there are currently any readable channels, false otherwise.

      • readableChannelsProcessed

        protected void readableChannelsProcessed()
        Description copied from class: AbstractSelectableChannelReadMultiplexer
        Called when all readable channels have been processed.

        Designed to be used by sub-classes to clear down any post read state.
